column4: hui, it does work with ls. yay.. but it DOES NOT with lame and unrar for example

-h does not mean help

ahh. lame only takes *one* file to encode at a time
find ./ -iname '*.wav' -exec lame -h \{\} \;
or for each in *.wav ; do lame -h $each ; done
